Package ohos.event.notification

Class NotificationRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.event.notification.NotificationRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Sequenceable

    public final class NotificationRequest
extends Object
implements Sequenceable
    Carries notifications.

    In terms of notification publishing, you must call the setContent(ohos.event.notification.NotificationRequest.NotificationContent) method to specify the notification content, and call the setDeliveryTime(long) method to set when to deliver the notification, respectively. NotificationRequest is used as an input parameter in the NotificationHelper#publishNotification(NotificationRequest) method to publish a notification. In terms of notification subscription, you can inherit the NotificationSubscriber class and override the callback methods NotificationSubscriber#onConsumed(NotificationRequest) and NotificationSubscriber#onCanceled(NotificationRequest). The received or deleted notifications can be stored in the NotificationRequest object.

    Since:
    1
    See Also:
    NotificationHelper, NotificationSubscriber
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Notification#ANS

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  NotificationRequest.NotificationContent
      Sets the content of a notification to be passed to the NotificationRequest#setContent(NotificationRequest.NotificationContent) method.
      static class  NotificationRequest.NotificationConversationalContent
      Constructs a conversation-like notification that includes message communication among multiple users.
      static class  NotificationRequest.NotificationLongTextContent
      Constructs notifications that include long text.
      static class  NotificationRequest.NotificationMediaContent
      Constructs a media playback notification that can interact with associated audio sessions.
      static class  NotificationRequest.NotificationMultiLineContent
      Constructs a notification that includes multiple lines of text.
      static class  NotificationRequest.NotificationNormalContent
      Constructs basic notifications.
      static class  NotificationRequest.NotificationPictureContent
      Constructs notifications that include a picture attachment.

        Sequenceable.Producer<T>

      Indicates the classification of notifications for alarms or timers.

      Indicates the classification of notifications for emails.

      Indicates the classification of notifications for errors occurred during background operations or identity authentication.

      Indicates the classification of notifications for calendar events.

      Indicates the classification of notifications for short messages or instant messages.
      static String CLASSIFICATION_NAVIGATION
      Indicates the classification of notifications for map navigation.
      static String CLASSIFICATION_PROGRESS
      Indicates the classification of notifications for processes that are operated in the background for a long time.
      static String CLASSIFICATION_PROMO
      Indicates the classification of notifications for advertisement or promotion information.
      static String CLASSIFICATION_RECOMMENDATION
      Indicates the classification of notifications for specific and timely recommendations of a particular transaction.
      static String CLASSIFICATION_REMINDER
      Indicates the classification of notifications for reminders previously set by the user.
      static String CLASSIFICATION_SERVICE
      Indicates the classification of notifications for ongoing background services.
      static String CLASSIFICATION_SOCIAL
      Indicates the classification of notifications for social network or sharing updates.
      static String CLASSIFICATION_STATUS
      Indicates the classification of notifications for ongoing information about the device and contextual status.
      static String CLASSIFICATION_SYSTEM
      Indicates the classification of notifications for system or device status updates.
      static String CLASSIFICATION_TRANSPORT
      Indicates the classification of notifications for media transport control during playback.
      static int COLOR_DEFAULT
      Indicates the default notification background color, which means that no color is displayed.
      static String EXTRA_USER_INPUT_HISTORY
      getAdditionalData() key: this is the user input history, as supplied to setNotificationUserInputHistory(java.util.List).
      static int GROUP_ALERT_TYPE_ALL
      A notification group alert type, indicating that all notifications in a group have sound or vibration if sound or vibration is enabled for the associated NotificationSlot objects.
      static int GROUP_ALERT_TYPE_CHILD
      A notification group alert type, indicating that child notifications have sound or vibration but the overview notification is muted (no sound or vibration) in a group if sound or vibration is enabled for the associated NotificationSlot objects.
      static int GROUP_ALERT_TYPE_OVERVIEW
      A notification group alert type, indicating that the overview notification has sound or vibration but child notifications are muted (no sound or vibration) in a group if sound or vibration is enabled for the associated NotificationSlot objects.
      static Sequenceable.Producer<NotificationRequest> PRODUCER
      Creates a NotificationRequest instance from a Parcel.
      static int VISIBLENESS_TYPE_NO_OVERRIDE
      Indicates that the notification display effect has not been set by setVisibleness(int).
      static int VISIBLENESS_TYPE_PRIVATE
      Indicates that only the basic information, such as application icon and application name is displayed on the lock screen.
      static int VISIBLENESS_TYPE_PUBLIC
      Indicates that contents of a notification are displayed on the lock screen.
      static int VISIBLENESS_TYPE_SECRET
      Indicates that notifications are not displayed on the lock screen.

      • NotificationRequest

        public NotificationRequest​(int notificationId)

        Parameters:
        notificationId - Indicates the notification ID, which must be unique. You can set it to any int value.
        Since:
        1

      • NotificationRequest

        public NotificationRequest​(Context context,
                           int notificationId)
        A constructor used to create a NotificationRequest instance based on the specified context and notification ID. To publish a notification with a custom view, you must call such a constructor with the Context specified.
        Parameters:
        context - Indicates the context of the current application or ability. This parameter cannot be null if you want to publish a notification with a custom view.
        notificationId - Indicates the notification ID, which must be unique. You can set it to any int value.
        Since:
        3

      • setOnlyLocal

        public NotificationRequest setOnlyLocal​(boolean flag)
        Sets whether this notification is relevant only to the local device and cannot be displayed on remote devices. This method takes effect only for notifications published by calling NotificationHelper#publishNotification(NotificationRequest) or NotificationHelper#publishNotification(String, NotificationRequest). Notifications published using NotificationHelper#publishNotification(NotificationRequest, String) in a distributed system will not be affected.
        Parameters:
        flag - Specifies whether this notification can be displayed only on the local device. The value true indicates that it can be displayed only on the local device, and the value false indicates that it can also be displayed on remote devices.
        Returns:
        Returns the NotificationRequest object with the specified flag.
        Since:
        3

      • isOnlyLocal

        public boolean isOnlyLocal​()
        Checks whether this notification is relevant only to the local device and cannot be displayed on remote devices.
        Returns:
        Returns true if this notification is relevant only to the local device; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

        Since:

      • getAutoDeletedTime

        public long getAutoDeletedTime​()
        Obtains the period during which a notification is deleted.
        Returns:
        Returns the period in milliseconds.
        Since:
        1

      • getNotificationHashCode

        public String getNotificationHashCode​()
        Obtains the unique hash code of a notification in the current application.

        To obtain a valid hash code, you must have subscribed to and received the notification. A valid notification hash code is a string composed of multiple attributes separated by an underscore (_), including the notification ID, creator bundle name, creator UID, and owner bundle name.

        Returns:
        Returns the hash code of the notification.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        getNotificationId(), getCreatorBundleName(), getCreatorUid(), getOwnerBundleName()

      • setAutoDeletedTime

        public NotificationRequest setAutoDeletedTime​(long time)
        Sets the time to delete a notification.
        Parameters:
        time - Indicates the time in milliseconds. The default value is 0, indicating that the notification will not be automatically deleted. To enable the notification to be automatically deleted, set this parameter to an integer greater than 0.

      • getGroupValue

        public String getGroupValue​()
        Obtains the group information about this notification.
        Returns:
        Returns the group information about this notification.
        Since:
        3

      • setGroupValue

        public NotificationRequest setGroupValue​(String groupValue)
        Sets the group information for this notification.

        If no groups are set for notifications, all notifications from the same application will appear in the notification bar as one stack with the number of stacked notifications displayed. If notifications are grouped and there are multiple groups identified by different groupValue, notifications with different groupValue will appear in separate stacks.

        Note that one of the notifications in a group must be set as the overview of its group by calling setGroupOverview(boolean), and other notifications are considered as child notifications. Otherwise, notifications will not be displayed as one group even if they are assigned the same groupValue by calling setGroupValue(java.lang.String).

        Parameters:
        groupValue - Indicates the group value to be set for this notification.
        Returns:
        Returns the NotificationRequest object with the specified groupValue.
        Since:
        3

      • getGroupAlertType

        public int getGroupAlertType​()
        Obtains the group alert type of this notification.
        Returns:
        Returns the group alert type of this notification.
        Since:
        3

      • setGroupAlertType

        public NotificationRequest setGroupAlertType​(int groupAlertType)
        Sets the group alert type for this notification, which determines how the group overview and other notifications in a group are published.

        The group information must have been set by calling setGroupValue(java.lang.String). Otherwise, this method does not take effect.

        Parameters:
        groupAlertType - Indicates the group alert type to set, which can be GROUP_ALERT_TYPE_ALL (default value), GROUP_ALERT_TYPE_OVERVIEW, or GROUP_ALERT_TYPE_CHILD.
        Returns:
        Returns the NotificationRequest object with the specified groupAlertType.
        Since:
        3

      • isGroupOverview

        public boolean isGroupOverview​()
        Checks whether this notification is the group overview.
        Returns:
        Returns true if this notification is the group overview; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • setGroupOverview

        public NotificationRequest setGroupOverview​(boolean groupOverview)
        Sets whether to use this notification as the overview of its group. This method helps display the notifications that are assigned the same group value by calling setGroupValue(java.lang.String) as one stack in the notification bar.

        Each group requires only one group overview. After a notification is set as the group overview, it becomes invisible if another notification in the same group is published.

        Parameters:
        groupOverview - Specifies whether to set this notification as the group overview. The value true indicates that it is the group overview, ant the value false indicates not.
        Returns:
        Returns the NotificationRequest object with the specified groupOverview setting.
        Since:
        3

      • setMaxScreenIntentAgent

        public NotificationRequest setMaxScreenIntentAgent​(IntentAgent maxScreenIntentAgent)
        Sets the IntentAgent to start when the device is not in use, instead of showing this notification in the status bar.

        When the device is in use, the system UI displays a pop-up notification instead of starting the IntentAgent specified by maxScreenIntentAgent.

        Your application must have the ohos.permission.USE_WHOLE_SCREEN permission to use this method.

        Since:
        3

        public int getColor​()
        Obtains the background color of this notification.

        The return value, except for the default color COLOR_DEFAULT, is the bitwise OR operation result of 0xFF000000 and the ARGB value set by setColor(int).

        Returns the background color of this notification.
        Since:
        3

        Parameters:

      • isShowStopwatch

        public boolean isShowStopwatch​()
        Checks whether the notification creation time is displayed as a stopwatch.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the time is displayed as a stopwatch; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • setShowStopwatch

        public NotificationRequest setShowStopwatch​(boolean isStopwatch)
        Sets whether to show the notification creation time as a stopwatch. This method is valid only when the notification creation time has been set by calling setDeliveryTime(long).

        When the notification creation time is set to be shown as a stopwatch, the interval between the current time and the creation time set by setDeliveryTime(long) is dynamically displayed for this notification in Minutes: Seconds format. If the interval is longer than 60 minutes, it will be displayed in Hours: Minutes: Seconds format. If this method and setShowDeliveryTime(boolean) are both set to true, only this method takes effect, that is, the notification creation time will be shown as a stopwatch.

        Parameters:
        isStopwatch - Specifies whether to show the notification creation time as a stopwatch. The value true indicates that it is shown as a stopwatch, and the value false indicates not.
        Returns:
        Returns the NotificationRequest object with the specified isStopwatch setting.
        Since:
        3

      • isCountdownTimer

        public boolean isCountdownTimer​()
        Checks whether the notification creation time is displayed as a countdown timer.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the time is displayed as a countdown timer; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • setCountdownTimer

        public NotificationRequest setCountdownTimer​(boolean isCountDown)
        Sets whether to show the notification creation time as a countdown timer. This method is valid only when setShowStopwatch(boolean) is set to true.
        Parameters:
        isCountDown - Specifies whether to show the notification creation time as a countdown timer. The value true indicates that it is shown as a countdown timer, and the value false indicates not.
        Returns:
        Returns the NotificationRequest object with the specified isCountDown setting.
        Since:
        3

      • setVisibleness

        Sets the notification display effect, including whether to display this notification on the lock screen, and how it will be presented if displayed.

        For details, see NotificationSlot#setLockscreenVisibleness(int). If the lock screen display effect is set for a NotificationRequest object and its associated NotificationSlot object, the display effect set in the NotificationRequest object prevails.

        Parameters:

      • addActionButton

        public NotificationRequest addActionButton​(NotificationActionButton actionButton)
        Adds a NotificationActionButton to this notification. The system typically places action buttons next to the notification content.

        Each action button must contain an icon, a title, and an IntentAgent. When a notification is expanded, a maximum of three action buttons can be displayed from left to right in the order they were added. When the notification is collapsed, no action buttons will be displayed.

        Parameters:
        actionButton - Indicates the NotificationActionButton object to add.
        Returns:
        Returns the NotificationRequest object with the specified actionButton.
        Since:
        3

      • getActionButtons

        Returns:

        3

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Returns the NotificationRequest object with the specified request.
        Since:

      • setNotificationUserInputHistory

        public NotificationRequest setNotificationUserInputHistory​(List<String> text)
        Sets the most recent NotificationUserInput records that have been sent through this notification.

        The most recent input must be stored in index 0, the second most recent input must be stored in index 1, and so on. The system displays a maximum of five inputs.

        Parameters:
        text - Indicates the list of inputs to set.
        Returns:
        Returns the NotificationRequest object with the specified text.
        Since:
        3

      • getLabel

        public String getLabel​()
        Obtains the label of this notification.

        The label is set via NotificationHelper#publishNotification(String, NotificationRequest). This method returns null if no specific label is set for this notification.

        Returns:
        Returns the label of this notification.
        Since:
        4

      • setBadgeIconStyle

        public NotificationRequest setBadgeIconStyle​(int badgeIconStyle)
        Sets the badge icon style for this notification.

        This method does not take effect if the home screen does not support badge icons.

        Parameters:
        badgeIconStyle - Indicates the type of the badge icon to be displayed for this notification. The value must be BADGE_STYLE_NONE, BADGE_STYLE_LITTLE, or BADGE_STYLE_BIG.
        Returns:
        Returns the NotificationRequest object with the specified badgeIconStyle.
        Since:
        4

      • getBadgeIconStyle

        public int getBadgeIconStyle​()
        Obtains the badge icon style of this notification.
        Returns:
        Returns the badge icon style of this notification.
        Since:
        4

      • setShortcutId

        public NotificationRequest setShortcutId​(String shortcutId)
        Sets the shortcut ID for this notification.

        After a shortcut ID is set for a notification, the notification will be associated with the corresponding home-screen shortcut, and the shortcut will be hidden when the Home application displays the badge or content of the notification.

        Parameters:
        shortcutId - Indicates the shortcut ID to set.
        Returns:
        Returns the NotificationRequest object with the specified shortcutId.
        Since:
        4

      • getShortcutId

        public String getShortcutId​()
        Obtains the shortcut ID associated with this notification.
        Returns:
        Returns the shortcut ID of this notification.
        Since:
        4

      • marshalling

        public boolean marshalling​(Parcel out)
        Marshals a NotificationRequest object into a Parcel.

        A process can call the unmarshalling(ohos.utils.Parcel) method to unmarshal a NotificationRequest object from a Parcel to implement inter-process communication (IPC).

        Specified by:
        marshalling in interface Sequenceable
        Parameters:
        out - Indicates the MessageParcel object for marshalling. MessageParcel is a child class of Parcel.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the marshalling is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • unmarshalling

        public boolean unmarshalling​(Parcel in)
        Unmarshals a NotificationRequest object from a Parcel.
        Specified by:
        unmarshalling in interface Sequenceable
        Parameters:
        in - Indicates the MessageParcel object for marshalling. MessageParcel is a child class of Parcel.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the unmarshalling is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • toString

        public String toString​()
        Description copied from class: Object
        Returns a string representation of the object. In general, the toString method returns a string that "textually represents" this object. The result should be a concise but informative representation that is easy for a person to read. It is recommended that all subclasses override this method.

        The toString method for class Object returns a string consisting of the name of the class of which the object is an instance, the at-sign character `@', and the unsigned hexadecimal representation of the hash code of the object. In other words, this method returns a string equal to the value of: 

         getClass().getName() + '@' + Integer.toHexString(hashCode())
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of the object.
        Since:
        4
